title: [Self-directed] Cognitive Wireless Communication System Performance Analysis and Foundations of Deep Learning Modeling

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary wireless communication principles and mathematical foundations (algebra, probability)
context.additional_context: Learners operate in smartphone-based constrained technology environments, with access to computational tools (simple online calculators, etc.) for real-world problem-solving

learning_goals: Learners can explain the fundamental principles of cognitive radio systems and NOMA (Non-Orthogonal Multiple Access) technical architecture.
Learners can simulate system performance (outage probability, throughput) using deep learning-based predictive models.
Learners can comparatively analyze power constraints and interference management strategies considering real communication environments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
